text_blocks.title: What is ChatGPT?
text_blocks.snippet: ChatGPT is a generative artificial intelligence chatbot developed by OpenAI and launched in November 2022. It's credited with accelerating the ongoing AI boom and has become one of the fastest-growing consumer software applications ever, gaining over 100 million users in two months.

snippets.Conversational AI: ChatGPT engages in human-like dialogue, answering follow-up questions, correcting mistakes, and challenging incorrect premises.
snippets.Content Generation: It can produce various forms of content, including articles, social media posts, emails, essays, and code, tailored to user prompts.
snippets.Code Understanding and Generation: ChatGPT can write and debug computer programs across multiple languages, acting as a valuable tool for developers and beginners alike.
snippets.Translation: It supports over 80 languages and can translate text and even spoken language in real-time, bridging communication gaps.
snippets.Information Retrieval and Summarization: ChatGPT can search the web for real-time information, summarize lengthy articles or reports, and explain complex topics simply.
snippets.Image and Video Generation: With recent updates, ChatGPT can now generate images using GPT-4o and access OpenAI's Sora model for video creation, expanding its multimodal capabilities.
snippets.Custom GPTs and AI Agents: Paid users can create custom versions of ChatGPT tailored for specific tasks and personalities. OpenAI has also launched AI agent features like Operator and ChatGPT agent, allowing the AI to autonomously perform tasks using virtual tools like a web browser and terminal.

text_blocks.title: How it works
text_blocks.snippet: ChatGPT relies on transformer neural networks, a type of deep learning algorithm. It learns to predict the next word or phrase in a sequence based on the context of the previous ones by analyzing relationships within a vast training dataset of text, images, audio, and video. It also utilizes techniques like reinforcement learning from human feedback (RLHF) and chain-of-thought (CoT) reasoning to improve its safety, effectiveness, and ability to handle complex problems.
